column4: text
Taking everything into account, would you say the overall quality of life in your area is excellent, good, average, not so good, or poor?
What about the direction of the State of Illinois? Generally speaking, are things in Illinois going in the right direction, or are they off track and heading in the wrong direction?
How are things going in your city or area of the state? In general, are things in your city or area going in the right direction, or in the wrong direction?
Generally speaking, do you think things in our country are going in the right direction, or are they off track and heading in the wrong direction?

People have proposed a constitutional amendment that would have legislative district maps created and recommended by a commission that is independent of the elected representatives. Would you favor or oppose this proposal?

A proposal to limit state legislators to a total of eight years of service, whether in the House of Representatives, the State Senate, or a combination of the two. Would you favor or oppose this proposal?
column5: In 2010, 2011, 2012 the question was more specific asking about a proposal to "limit state representatives to five consecutive two-year terms and state senators to three consecutive four-year terms."

column4: On the ballot in November is an amendment to the Illinois Constitution that would make sure funds from the gasoline tax, tolls, license fees, and other transportation levies can only be spent on roads, bridges, and other transportation-related projects. If that question were on the ballot today, would you vote for or against it?

I'm going to read three statements that people have made about how to fix the deficit, and ask you which one comes closest to your views. If you haven't thought much about this issue, just tell me that. We can only fix the problem by taking in more revenue, such as a tax increase; we can fix the problem by cutting waste and innefficiency in government, OR the budget problem is so large it can only be solved by a combination of budget cuts and revenue increases.
column5: Each year the current deficit was stated. This has varied.
column9: Both increase revenues and cut waste

column4: Do you favor or oppose cuts in state spending on pension benefits for state workers' retirement?
Do you favor or oppose cuts in state spending on public safety, such as state policy and prison operations?
Do you favor or oppose cuts in state spending on programs for people with mental or physical disabilities?
Do you favor or oppose cuts in state spending on state universities?
Do you favor or oppose cuts in state spending on kindergarten through high school education?
Do you favor or oppose cuts in state spending on natural resources, such as state parks or environmental regulation?

column2: Cuts to Programs for Poor People
column4: Do you favor or oppose cuts in state spending on programs for poor people?
Do you favor or oppose a proposal to expand legalized gambling in the state?
Do you favor or oppose expanding the sales tax to cover services like dry cleaning or haircuts, which are not currently taxed?
Do you favor or oppose a proposal to restore the temporary state income tax increase, raising it from 3.75 percent to 5 percent?
column5: This question dealt with raising income tax before the temporary measure was in place. When it was in place it asked about continuing it and once it expired the question asked about reinstating the increase. Specifically in 2009 the question asked: "Do you favor or oppose a proposal to raise the state income tax rate from 3 percent to 4.5 percent? "; in 2013-4 it asked: "do you favor or oppose a proposal to make permanent the state income tax increase..."; and in 2015-6 it asked: do you favor or oppose a proposal to restore the temporary state income tax increase, raising it from 3.65 to 5 percent?"

column4: Do you favor or oppose a proposal to impose an extra 3 percent state tax on all income above $1 million a year?

Would you favor or oppose a proposal to change the Illinois Constitution to allow a graduated income tax-that is, tax rates would be lower for lower-income taxpayers and higher for upper-income taxpayers?
Would you favor or oppose a proposal to raise the state gasoline tax to fund improvements to Illinois highways, roads, and bridges?
Do you favor or oppose applying the state income tax to retirement income such as pensions and Social Security?
Have you or someone in your immediate family been affected by the Illinois budget stalemate?
Do you think abortions should be legal under all circumstances, legal only under certain circumstances, or illegal in all circumstances?

Which of the following three statements comes closest to your position on the legal rights of gay and lesbian couples in Illinois? Gay and lesbian couples should be allowed to legally marry; gay and lesbian couples should be allowed to form civil unions, but not legally marry; OR there should be no legal recognition of relationships between gay and lesbian couples?
I would like for you to tell me how Governor Bruce Rauner is doing his job. Do you approve or disapprove of the job Governor Rauner is doing?
I'd like for you to tell me how well Speaker of the Illinois House of Representatives Michael Madigan is doing his job. Do you approve, or disapprove of the job Speaker Madigan is doing?
I'd like for you to tell me how well Illinois Senate President John Cullerton is doing his job. Do you approve, or disapprove of the job Senate President Cullerton is doing?
Thinking about the upcoming elections, are you more enthusiastic than usual about voting, or less enthusiastic?
If the election was being held today would you vote for?
If the election for US Senator from Illinois was being held today, would you vote for?
If the election for Illinois Comptroller was being held today, would you vote for?
Would you say your overall opinion of labor unions is favorable or unfavorable?
Do you favor or oppose right-to-work or open-shop laws?
Would you personally like to see labor unions in the United States have more influence than they have today, the same amount, or less influence than they have today?

I'm going to read two statements about organized labor, then ask you to tell me which comes closer to your own views, even if neither is exactly how you fell. First is, when everyone in the workplace shares the gains won by the labor union, all workers shoud have to contribute to the union's costs for negotiating those gains; OR no American should be required to pay udes to a private organization like a labor union against their will.
column8: Shouldn't be forced to pay dues

column4: Thinking ahead how likely is it that you will move to a different state in the next 12 months?
Regardless of whether you will move, if you had the opportunity, would you like to move to another state?

Which of these statements comes closer to your view, even if neither is exactly right: The earth is getting warmer mostly because of human activity, such as burning fossil fuels; OR the earth is getting warmer mostly because of natural patterns in the earth's environment; OR there is no solid evidence the earth is getting warmer
column9: No evidence the earth is getting warmer

column4: Which of these statements comes closer to your view, even if neither is exactly right: Protection of the environment should be given priority, even at the risk of curbing economic growth; OR economic growth should be given priority, even if the environment suffers to some extent

Do you agree or disagree that judges should be allowed to make exceptions to minimum sentencing laws for veterans who are convicted of crimes but have service related disabilities like post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury?
